definition: without a penny to one's name/penniless/stony-broke
name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit

sentences.english: Ill health seems to have cleared Sarah out.
sentences.chinese: 看来体弱多病已经把萨拉弄得不名一文。

sentences.english: The Moneyless Man knows how to party for free
sentences.chinese: 下文这位不名一文的强人教你如何免费开派对。

sentences.english: He is a millionaire and his father without a cent.
sentences.chinese: 他是百万富翁而他父亲却不名一文。

sentences.english: Such studies are to me unworthy ones.
sentences.chinese: 这些学问对我而言不名一文。

sentences.english: Why is the man who invests all your a broker?
sentences.chinese: 为什么帮你管理所有投资的人叫做“不名一文的人”？

sentences.english: And, of course, he ended up without any money.
sentences.chinese: 当然了，最后他不名一文。

sentences.english: The Eighth People's Hospital of Guangzhou, the penniless in a prescribed body.
sentences.chinese: 广州市第八人民医院内，于得明身上不名一文。

definition: down and out/in dire straits/unrestrained/unconventional/also pr. [luo4 tuo4]
to possess nothing except bare necessities/to live a poor or frugal life
poor wretch/pauper/destitute man/poverty-stricken peasant/penniless good-for-nothing/impecunious vagabond
having wealth equivalent to that of an entire nation (idiom)/extremely wealthy
extreme poverty (idiom); destitute/penniless/poor as church mice
